channel.title: DC-Deober error
channel.description:
When I use DC's deober I get
[code]Dumping jar file... 'jar' is not recognized as an internal or external command, operable program or batch file. The system cannot find the file specified.[/code]
And here is the batch file.
[code]@echo off title DC-Deobber echo. echo ++--------------++ echo ______ ______ echo / / / ____ \ echo / / . echo / [] / . echo / / . ____ echo /_____/ \______/ echo. echo ++--------------++ echo. cd bin if exist ..\runescape.jar goto start if defined HD ( echo Downloading HD Client wget http://world106.runescape.com/runescape_hd.jar @ren runescape_hd.jar runescape.jar ) else ( echo Downloading Regular Client wget http://world106.runescape.com/runescape.jar ) goto findversion
:start @copy ..\runescape.jar .\ @del ..\runescape.jar goto findversion
:findversion title Finding Version... java -cp ./DC-Deob.jar -classpath ./bcel.jar;./regexp.jar;./DC-Deob.jar;./classpath.zip; FindVersion ./runescape.jar echo. goto rename
:rename title Renaming... java -cp ZKM.jar ZKM rs2.txt @del ZKM_log.txt ChangeLog.txt .\runescape.jar.BACKUP goto deobfuscate
:deobfuscate title Deobfuscating... java -cp ./DC-Deob.jar -classpath ./bcel.jar;./regexp.jar;./DC-Deob.jar;./classpath.zip; DCDeob ./runescape.jar @del .\runescape.jar goto decompile
:decompile title Decompiling... md ~deob cd ~deob jar xf ../deob.jar if defined DECOMPILER ( "../jad.exe" -sjava -t *.class ) else ( java -cp ../jode.jar -classpath ../jode.jar;../classpath.zip; jode.decompiler.Main --dest . ../Deob.jar ) copy ..\~rsver ~rsver echo e 100 "set RSVER=" > ~tmpdebug echo n ~tmp >> ~tmpdebug echo rcx >> ~tmpdebug echo a >> ~tmpdebug echo w >> ~tmpdebug echo q >> ~tmpdebug debug < ~tmpdebug > nul copy ~tmp+~rsver ~rsver.bat > nul call ~rsver.bat title Dumping Jar File echo Dumping jar file... jar cf ..\%RSVER% *.class *.java copy %RSVER% %RSVER% > nul goto finish
:finish title Finishing Up... cd .. @copy .\%RSVER% ..\ @del %RSVER% Deob.jar ~rsver rd ~deob /s /q echo. echo +----------------Done!----------------+ pause goto exitdeobber
:exitdeobber cd .. exit[/code]
I know this is like when you have the wrong version of jdk and have to change it but I don't know what to do for this. I've never had to jar anything before, I've only used jdk for compiling and running. I'm not sure if the jarring part classpath is right. Like I said I haven't jarred anything before.
I know it's noob but please help and no flamming.
Thanks ~Fearrichy

item.title: DC-Deober error
item.dc:creator: @fearrichy fearrichy
item.description:
@fearrichy wrote:

When I use DC’s deober I get

Dumping jar file... 'jar' is not recognized as an internal or external command, operable program or batch file. The system cannot find the file specified.

And here is the batch file.

[code]@echo off
title DC-Deobber
echo.
echo +±-------------++
echo ______ ______
echo / / / ____
echo / / .
echo / [] / .
echo / / . ____
echo // _/
echo.
echo +±-------------++
echo.
cd bin
if exist …\runescape.jar goto start
if defined HD (
echo Downloading HD Client
wget http://world106.runescape.com/runescape_hd.jar
@ren runescape_hd.jar runescape.jar
) else (
echo Downloading Regular Client
wget http://world106.runescape.com/runescape.jar
)
goto findversion

:start
@copy …\runescape.jar .
@del …\runescape.jar
goto findversion

:findversion
title Finding Version…
java -cp ./DC-Deob.jar -classpath ./bcel.jar;./regexp.jar;./DC-Deob.jar;./classpath.zip; FindVersion ./runescape.jar
echo.
goto rename

:rename
title Renaming…
java -cp ZKM.jar ZKM rs2.txt
@del ZKM_log.txt ChangeLog.txt .\runescape.jar.BACKUP
goto deobfuscate

:deobfuscate
title Deobfuscating…
java -cp ./DC-Deob.jar -classpath ./bcel.jar;./regexp.jar;./DC-Deob.jar;./classpath.zip; DCDeob ./runescape.jar
@del .\runescape.jar
goto decompile

:decompile
title Decompiling…
md ~deob
cd ~deob
jar xf …/deob.jar
if defined DECOMPILER (
“…/jad.exe” -sjava -t *.class
) else (
java -cp …/jode.jar -classpath …/jode.jar;…/classpath.zip; jode.decompiler.Main --dest . …/Deob.jar
)
copy …~rsver ~rsver
echo e 100 “set RSVER=” > ~tmpdebug
echo n ~tmp >> ~tmpdebug
echo rcx >> ~tmpdebug
echo a >> ~tmpdebug
echo w >> ~tmpdebug
echo q >> ~tmpdebug
debug < ~tmpdebug > nul
copy ~tmp+~rsver ~rsver.bat > nul
call ~rsver.bat
title Dumping Jar File
echo Dumping jar file…
jar cf …%RSVER% *.class *.java
copy %RSVER% %RSVER% > nul
goto finish

:finish
title Finishing Up…
cd …
@copy .%RSVER% …
@del %RSVER% Deob.jar ~rsver
rd ~deob /s /q
echo.
echo ±---------------Done!----------------+
pause
goto exitdeobber

:exitdeobber
cd …
exit[/code]

I know this is like when you have the wrong version of jdk and have to change it but I don’t know what to do for this. I’ve never had to jar anything before, I’ve only used jdk for compiling and running. I’m not sure if the jarring part classpath is right. Like I said I haven’t jarred anything before.

I know it’s noob but please help and no flamming.

Thanks
~Fearrichy
